intro: Fouquieria ochoterenae, commonly known as the Ocotlan candleplant, is a member of the Nyctaginaceae family and is native to the arid regions of Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant is adapted to survive in dry environments, storing water in its succulent stems and leaves. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitat. The species is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in xeriscapes.
